text: HTLV-1 <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induces expression of various immediate early serum responsive genes .
Human T-cell leukemia virus type 1 ( HTLV-1 ) is an etiological agent of adult T-cell leukemia ( ATL ) .
We showed here by mobility-shift assay that T-cell lines transformed with the virus contained high levels of AP-1 activities .

Consistent with this result , these cell lines expressed increased levels of mRNAs encoding the AP-1 proteins , <extra_id_0> c-Fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> Fra-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> c-Jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> JunB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> JunD <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Previously , transcription of the <extra_id_0> c-fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene has been reported to be transactivated by the viral transcription factor , <extra_id_0> Tax1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

By using the human T-cell line ( JPX-9 ) , in which expression of the <extra_id_0> Tax1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is inducible , we showed that expression of mRNAs for <extra_id_0> Fra-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> c-Jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> JunD <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was also transactivated by <extra_id_0> Tax1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Moreover , <extra_id_0> Tax1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activated expression of two other transcription factors having zinc finger motifs , <extra_id_0> Egr-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Egr-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , in the same cells .
The <extra_id_0> Tax1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - inducible transcription factors identified here are encoded by the members of immediate early genes under the control of growth signals .
Thus , <extra_id_0> Tax1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was suggested to replace growth signals , at least in part , by this mechanism .
